ygData.subject: RE: Brian, why better ac for rogues, bards, and rangers?
ygData.msgSnippet: The answer would be we are continuously being screwed! Sthiel
ygData.messageBody:
The answer would be we are continuously being screwed!

Sthiel

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Chip Paul [mailto:cpaul@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, October 19, 1999 10:24 AM
> To: shadowknight@onelist.com
> Subject: [shadowknight] Brian, why better ac for rogues, bards, and
> rangers?
>
>
> From: Chip Paul <cpaul@...>
>
> I don't understand why the chain based armor of the rangers has a
> higher AC than our darkforge armor, and arguably better statistics.
> All of the ranger armor I've seen has excellent bonuses to pertinent
> stats. Example.
>
> Ivy etched tunic (ranger): 19AC +3Str +3Wis +30HP
> Darkforge breastplate (sk): 18AC +10Sta +3Mr
>
> I don't know exactly how stamina works, but I know that the +6 stamina
> on my charred bp equates to about 13HP for me at level 33.
>
> The leggings...
> Lambent greaves (bard): 13AC +1Cha +5Agi weight 4.0
> Darkforge greaves(sk): 11AC +9Sta +3Mr weight 7
> Ivy Etched greaves(rng): 12AC +5Agi +5Fire +5Cold
>
> Bard: 2 AC more and weighs 3lbs less. Also, the Agi bonus will give
> another point or two of ac.
>
> Ranger: 1 more AC
>
> I hear they are upping the crusader spawns, which is good, but
> really why do the rangers have higher ac on their chain armor? It
> doesn't make sense.
>
> Xilith
>
> > -=The Shadow Knight Mailing List=-
> -= Support Evil Roleplaying =-
>
